After all, it was your suggestion that allowed us to experience these precious moments together.

Title: Sunflower's Gift
Content:
Good afternoon, Commandant. How are you today?
When I sent you back, I wanted to give you this gift in person. However, after a second thought, I decided to include it in this mail instead, because I believe that written words have a more lasting impact than spoken ones.
I crafted this framed sunflower during my spare time. It reminded me of that day we watched the sunrise together on the beach and the poem I shared with you. In the poem, the sunflower yearns for sunshine, patiently waiting for the arrival of each sunrise, only to see the sun depart, making way for the sunset.
There was a time, long ago, when I was a traveling merchant. I, too, felt limited in what I could achieve, slowly growing while simply following the endless flow of mundane tasks...
However, after I came to Babylonia, you celebrated my activation date with me, and everyone took the opportunity to get acquainted little by little. Many things have started to change since then.

This year has been filled with many memories of our time together, and as a result, I found the future that I was looking forward to...
I'm deeply grateful for everything you did for me at that time. Thank you... thank you for having faith in me, regardless of what happened.
I remember every word you've said to me... and I will always cherish those moments.

Title: Good Afternoon, Commandant
Content: Good afternoon, Commandant. Today is my Activation Date.\nLucia has been preparing dinner since this morning, but don't worry. There are no missions today, so both Lee and I are here to help her. By the way, your meeting should be over by the evening, right? Lee just asked Celica to help you with the paperwork. You don't need to worry about things on our end, so please rest assured. We'll be waiting for you in the lounge, as usual.

Title: This Is Hippocrates...
Content:
Gray Raven Commandant, right? Here's your health check-up report from last month.
Liv was supposed to bring it back to you, but it seems she might have been delayed by something. After she finished writing her notes this morning, she left the report at the medical center. I tried calling her, but she didn't answer... I assume she is already with you by now.
She always meticulously checks your health reports multiple times, fearing that something might be overlooked. Then, she creates detailed plans, with categorized notes for different aspects. You should know best what kind of person she is. She never shows any signs of anxiety in front of me and always keeps things to herself...
Even on a day like today, her thoughts are not focused on herself. She must have prepared something for you and the other two members of Gray Raven. Well... that's just Liv for you.
So, please take good care of yourself. This is not medical advice from me as a doctor but a wish from Liv's heart.
Other than that, be sure to take her heart's desire and make it come true.

Title: About The Longevity Noodle Contest
Content: Commandant, long time no see! Guess what? There's this longevity noodle contest happening today on the Nighter. Apparently, the challenge is to make a 100-meter-long noodle. And you know what the prize is? The Kong Fu Bible I've been dying to get my hands on! I never expected the event host to have such a treasure. But here's the thing... making a 100-meter-long noodle all on my own might be quite tricky. That's where you come in, Commandant! You can take charge of the dough kneading, and I'll pull it into noodles. With our teamwork, victory is practically guaranteed!\nSo, how about we make a little bet? If you help me win the contest, I'll let you borrow the grand prize. Deal?\nWell then, I'll see you there, Commandant!

Title: This Codex Should Be Yours!
Content:
I never thought you would win on your own during the kneading stage...
But in the end, there were no extra rules to prevent you from winning the contest by forming those "100 meters" letters with flour...
Well, thank you for graciously giving the prize to me, but let's be real, you earned it fair and square with your own hard work. I'm happy to settle for a copy. The original should stay with the rightful winner!
In return, how about we celebrate my Activation Date together again next year? We can plan a more fun event with everyone!
Unfortunately, I only have one Activation Date every year, and it always feels like I can never find a good excuse at other times. Wait, I mean... it's not an excuse!
It's just that... who knows how long it'll be until we meet again... Oh, right! Now that you've got that secret codex of martial arts, we can train together!
Building physical strength is crucial for a commandant like you, isn't it? So, let's work on our inner power! May our journey lead us to the pinnacle of martial arts!
*If, by any chance, you dare to slack off and not come find me, I'll go all the way to Babylonia to check up on you.

Title: Regarding Hamlet
Content:
Hm... Is this Gray Raven Commandant?
I believe you're the only person apart from Selena who's used this Hamlet prototype, right? Ayla was bothering me a few days ago about "this time of the year again" as she went on and on about "friendship and bond" and how she wouldn't "give up on hope." She asked me to fix this prototype, and she said you were involved too... I have to manually configure 20000 sequences every time I turn it on! This is ridiculous.
Anyway, this thing showed up, and Ayla had her gunlance ready by the time I found it as she prepared to go to the surface.
Now... if you really "capture" Selena this time, lecture her on my behalf! Even if it's unlikely...
By the way, are you guys using me as a radio operator? Hamlet is not a radio, dammit...

Title: ▅█▁▃█▃...
Content:
Conductor, you should go see the pine forest up North in early fall.
Across cliffs and ranges, over the stormy sea, there is a pine forest—
When soil dried up back then, trees held hands with their companions...
Like lovers even as they fell.
They stayed together for centuries, eventually becoming coal.
Their scent smells of mud, trees, pinecones, and the morning dew.

As I lay on top of this burning land, Conductor, I can smell it.
The scent travels through villages in the morning, at noon, and in the evening.
Young children would jump around in the mist.
Sunlight glows sporadically amidst wheat, grains, and corn.
I see it, Conductor.
We can reap the sunlight with our sickles, piling them into small heaps and storing them in barns.
Leave these moments in the breeze in the homelands we left behind—
Every day, every month, every year... the sun will warm our hearts all the same.
